page.title: 01D-Block near Faversham
page.content: Our D-Block is situated to the west of the town of{Faversham.}It contains many of the features of the {Kentish}countryside that give rise to the name:{"The Garden of England". Most of the land is intensively farmed with orchards,soft fruit,sheep and hops the main land users. Woodland still survives much as coppice. Footpaths criss-cross the block and are increasingly being used. Many fine buildings still exist usually as isolated farms or small communities. Three major transport networks pass through the block. The newest is the M2 motorway ,which bisects the southern corner. To the north is the railway and running parallel the A2, being for hundreds of years the only road from London to Dover,via Canterbury.
